Name: Skyward Voyage
Description: An old captain named Davide is preparing for the last voyage of his life. But this time, his sights are set on something above the seas...
QuestDesc: An old captain named Davide is preparing for the last voyage of his life. But this time, his sights are set on something above the seas...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahoy there, young stranger.

Options.PlotLineKey: Hi, What are you doing here?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Feel the briny wind from the sea? A perfect day for a voyage with the calm waves, eh?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: See, that's my Gondola over there. As long as she's with me, there is no place in Rinascita we can't reach.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, where are my manners? Name's Davide, Captain Davide, or... boatman perhaps. Doesn't matter which to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm retiring anyway.

Options.PlotLineKey: But you don't look ready to retire just yet.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've got that right. I can still run a full trip to Septimont, singing shanties and puffing on my pipe the whole way.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No storm's ever bested me and my Gondola, and none will.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But every tale needs a proper ending. I reckon it's time for my last grand voyage.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nah, it's alright. All I want is one last sail to somewhere I've never been to, before I settle down for good in the city.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've crossed Nimbus Sanctum, seen Lorelei dancing among the stars, and ventured to forbidden lands, through reefs sharp as daggers.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From the dread lurking in the abyss to the beauty of fantasy islands, I've seen more than enough.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's only one place left in all of Rinascita that I haven't conquered—the sky.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aye! Now you probably think I've got a few bolts loose, eh? Older and crazier than the lot on Pilgrim's Sails.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But this is no joke. There were nights I dreamed of my Gondola and I gliding on the wind.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We would pass the rainbow bridge and see birds flashing beneath the boat like fish in a coral reef. Imagine that—a voyage like no other.

Options.PlotLineKey: But can a Gondola really fly?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've got faith in her. All she needs is the right push, and she'll take me up there.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know what I'm talking about. In fact, we did come close one time.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We were out at sea when we got caught in a... what do they call it? Tornado? Felt like a giant hand grabbed us and flung us into the air.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, no need to worry. That was just a starter compared to the worst I've seen. Now, you seem like a kind soul. Think you can help me find something as powerful as that tornado?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Naturally, there's something in it for you. Whatever treasure I find on this journey is yours.

Options.PlotLineKey: There's a treasure in the sky?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They say, "At the end of the rainbow lies gold." The same goes for the clouds. In Rinascita, there's a tale of a ruin from the Dark Tide, said to be filled with treasure.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But for me, steering my Gondola toward treasures lost to time is worth more than any treasure itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, what do you say? Not a bad offer, eh?

Options.PlotLineKey: What kind of power do you need?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me think... I remember, in Ragunna, there's a TD built like a giant stuffed toy but packed with raw strength.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If we can turn it into an Echo, it should be strong enough to launch us into the sky. Then I'll just leave the rest to my Gondola—I trust her.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah-ha! That's the Echo! Thank you, young one!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem... though I do have one more favor to ask.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd like to share with you this moment of thrill as I break free from the earth and reach for the sky.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Would you do me the honor of witnessing my voyage?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Excellent! Now, eyes on me!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Time to set sail!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Give it all you've got, big fella!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh... guess my old bones weren't ready for that.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *Coughs*... Oh, it's you. Gave you a bit of a laugh, did I?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But for me and my Gondola here, this is nothing at all. Right, partner?

Dialogues.Speaker: Davide's Gondola
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *A confident whistle*

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you'd seen us take on the raging seas, you'd know this is smooth sailing.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've ridden down waves taller than mountains without a scratch. This drop's barely worth mentioning.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It clearly didn't go as planned. What's holding us back?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe Gondolas aren't built for flight, eh? Even with a boost, all we'd get is a short glide.

Options.PlotLineKey: Short glide? More like a nose dive.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, alright, I may have put too much faith in my old partner. She's always been unstoppable in my memory.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hard to believe there are things she can't do...

Dialogues.Speaker: Davide's Gondola
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *A protesting whistle*

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Easy there, partner. I'm not griping. Just saying we need a new plan.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In my younger days, I saw flying balloons at the Carnevale that could lift a single person up into the air.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I can't just leave my boat behind. What kind of captain would I be without her?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Still, it's not a bad starting point. Now, what could we use instead of a balloon?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me see... Ah, yes. There's a flying TD in Penitent's End called Fae Ignis.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If we turn them into Echoes and load them aboard, there's a fair chance they'll give us the lift we need.

Options.PlotLineKey: Now that sounds like a plan.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, mind making one more trip for this old man?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, young one.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aye, that's the one!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. I'll be ready in a minute!

Options.PlotLineKey: I've got bad feelings about this...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll take that blessing!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rest easy! No storms can get the best of me!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Brace yourself—you're about to see us conquer the sky!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've got it this time...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hold on... these Fae Ignis are acting strange.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, it's good to see you again, my friend.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *Coughs*... No need to worry. Just a minor setback, nothing I can't handle.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rough landing aside, I'd say things went fairly well.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At least my partner and I managed to fly, though it was not the voyage I had in mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe I'm just getting old, old enough to forget Fae Ignis can go off like firecrackers...

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you giving it another go?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For sure! Even if I wanted to quit, my partner would never allow it.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not a chance. Even if I wanted to quit, my partner would never allow it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Davide's Gondola
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *A supportive whistle*

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hah! That's right, partner! We'll be above the clouds!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Could you do me one more favor, my friend? I swear this will be the last one.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I believe we are on the right track. Echoes can make a Gondola fly, but only the right ones can make a Gondola soar.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If, just if, we could get our hands on a calm flying Echo like a Wingray...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come to think of it, there used to be Wingrays here, but they've all vanished recently.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Could it be… those masked fellas in red uniforms?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah yes, the Fractsidus! They've got a camp around here. Haven't been there, but I've spotted them firing at the sky.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are they… poaching the Wingrays? By the Sentinel, those transgressors will answer for this!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Would you mind heading over to take a look? If they've taken the Wingrays, please save them.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It worked! We're flying! Keep it steady, partner! Take us to the clouds!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: See that, my friend? We made it! Want to join us for a view of the heavens?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait… how do I control this thing… no, no, how do I stop it?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Old Captain" Davide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: N-no matter! This is my last voyage! Onward! Nothing can stop me now!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus has locked up the Wingrays.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These doors look flimsy. Perhaps a heavy blow may break them down.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The gate's open.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's bring this Wingray to Captain Davide.
